steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3loa6","text":"Use DIMPLE to generate mutagenic oligos and primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ph9c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2j6qh","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5418FC4B345311EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":556,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"3fj0v\",\"text\":\"Snapshot of the default DIMPLE GUI\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/imvpbhznf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/imvmbhznf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/imvnbhznf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/imvkbhznf.webp","width":422.95988934993096}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1b3tl","text":"Important notes: DIMPLE breaks a gene up into sub-library fragments and generates mutagenic insert oligo pools, where each oligo contains barcodes, Type IIS restriction cutsites, and a sub-region of the gene. Be sure to review your library generation vector and gene sequences and look for pre-existing Type IIS restriction sites. Use site-directed mutagenesis to remove unwanted off-target sites. Also note that, by default, DIMPLE expects restriction enzymes with 6 bp recognition sites and 4 bp overhang lengths (as with BsaI and BsmBI).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"554s8","text":"Input wild type gene sequence: Input your gene sequence, including backbone, in fasta format. Place all genes to be mutagenized in the same fasta file. You can define which positions your genes start and end in the fasta header. Note that this uses 0 indexing: for example, if your first nucleotide is 884 on snapgene, use 883 in the fasta header). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpbq6","text":"For example: \u003egeneA start:35 end:250","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9ji4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jqje","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2b8lm","text":"*If you do not define your start \u0026 end position, the software will analyze different ORFs and ask you to define these positions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bg89","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3tkn8","text":"It is important to include the plasmid backbone so that the software can avoid making primers that nonspecifically recognize a region outside of your gene.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eehh8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qk2b","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"av3ek","text":"Using the DIMPLE GUI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8kjb","text":"Working Directory: When you open the DIMPLE GUI, first designate your working directory. This is the folder you wish your mutagenic oligo \u0026 primer outputs to be saved in.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2b3ea","text":"Target Gene File: Upload your gene fasta text file with the Target Gene File button.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lpau","text":"Oligo length: Designate the length of your oligo. This will include the barcodes, Type IIS restriction cutsite, and a region of your target gene that will be mutagenized. So, target gene +50bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h9pt","text":"Fragment length: You can adjust the length of your fragments, we recommend leaving the fragment length set to auto.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"245dp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7vin9","text":"DIMPLE will automatically break up your gene into roughly the same fragment sizes, and will determine which lengths work best to avoid matching overhangs.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sikn","text":"Fragment overlap: The number of base pairs shared between sub-regions. We have seen that setting overlap to 0 base pairs leads to errors. The overlap is set to 4 base pairs by default.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am1n1","text":"Barcode start position: The software selects from a set pool of barcodes when designing oligos. You can define which number barcode in the list this starts from.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gg8f","text":"Type IIS restriction sequence: You can select which Type IIS restriction cutsite you'd like to append to your inserts and backbone. You can choose between the BsmBI (CGTCTC) or BsaI (GGTCTC) sequences.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2asbn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8v5es","text":"Sequences to avoid: This will allow the code to design fragments without the cutsite you selected in the Type IIS restriction sequence section. If there is an error when running, this implies you have a cutsite in your gene or vector that needs to be removed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":105,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2vtp9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7oe1h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"607AE911F8C811EC998C0A58A9FEAC02","height":"123","is_video":false,"mime":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"data:image/png;base64,","source":"data:image/png;base64,","width":"678"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cipgs","text":"Codon usage: Your oligos can be codon optimized to your organism of choice. The default options are E. coli or Human, but you can also upload a codon usage table for any organism by pressing \"Custom codon usage.\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":100,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":111,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2k20k","text":"Select mutations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8h0ui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4g0d8","text":"Deletions: If you'd like to generate a library with deletions across your gene, select \"List of deletions\". Enter how many base pairs you'd like to be deleted across your library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1omnm","text":"For example, if you'd like deletions that are one codon long, enter \"3\" for 3 nucleotides.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"o151","text":"For example, If you'd like to include both deletions that are one codon long AND two codons long in the same pool, enter \"3,6\" for both 3, and 6 nucleotide long deletions.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1mn1b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9tcpe","text":"Insertions: If you'd like to generate a library with different amino acids inserted across your gene, select \"List of Insertions\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d2pcc","text":"For example, If you'd like to insert glycines across your gene, include \"GGG\" in the box.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"42b71","text":"For example, If you'd like to insert glycine-serine across your gene, include \"GGGTGC\" in the box.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f0c55","text":"For example, if you'd like to insert glycine AND glycine-serine across your gene, include \"GGG,GGGTGC\" in the box.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"75irp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"572ko","text":"Substitutions: If you'd like to generate a library where an amino acid at each position is swapped with every other possible amino acid, select \"Include Substitutions.\"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4h4o","text":"Run DIMPLE: Hit \"Run DIMPLE\" when you are ready to generate your pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjua8","text":"Examples of what the running code and outputs look like:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bpmk9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cn8qg","text":"The code will first iterate the ideal fragment length sizes across each gene of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5omle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eg177","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"542FA5DD345311EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":315,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/imv7bhznf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/imv5bhznf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/imv6bhznf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/imv4bhznf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98g7o","text":"Plate    of the last three dilutions (1:1000, 1:10000, 1:100000) on LB-agar with appropriate antibiotic. Grow overnight and count colonies the next day. Calculate the total number of transformants and determine the variant coverage per reaction. At least 50-fold coverage is essential. Note: the relevant measurement here is not transformation efficiency (i.e., cfu/ng), but simply total transformants!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":275,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":344,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":382,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"90C24D90D7B811EC8ADB354D952886D0","id":"92025","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b85n9","text":"Important QC step: pick single colonies from the QC plates and use clonal sequencing to check for mutations (e.g., Sanger sequencing or whole-plasmid sequencing). We typically pick 5 colonies per subpool and expect the majority to contain a desired mutation. Too much WT could indicate problems during the backbone amplification, and too many off-target mutations could suggest a failure to amplify or purify properly. In both cases, these would be extremely deleterious to the quality of the final library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2i0vh","text":"Add the remaining outgrowth culture to   LB supplemented with appropriate antibiotic for further outgrowth in either a Falcon tube or glass culture tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"2im8l","text":"Repeat transformation and isolation following steps for subpool cloning and quantification as above, except perform 6 serial dilutions and plate samples at 1:10000, 1:100000, and 1:1000000 dilutions and use variant counts for the total library. Again, at least 200-fold coverage is essential for maintaining unbiased libraries. Pick colonies and submit for clonal sequencing as well: we typically submit ~10 samples for our final pooled library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":282,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2q2qg","text":"Important QC step - evaluate the quality of the amplification with the gel. Each lane should have a single, crisp band at the expected size. Multiple bands, or no bands, might indicate improper annealing and may require Tm or extension time optimization. Blurry and smeary bands might indicate problems with the electrophoresis or amplification conditions. It is essential to get specific, clean amplification of the backbone, and libraries should not be generated with messy reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ruk4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4egma","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":309,"id":420060,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1a7ao\",\"text\":\"Example visualization of expected backbone amplification reactions on SYBR Safe-stained agarose gel. Each lane has a single, crisp band at the expected position that is well-separated from other lanes.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"gel sybrsafe.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n4g8brsjp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n4g6brsjp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n4g7brsjp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n4g5brsjp.webp","width":550}}}}
